visits.text: Discovery of the Ruta de las Flores: scenic route connecting the villages of Ataco and Apaneca
Stroll through the colorful streets of Ataco, known for their murals
Visit to a coffee plantation in Apaneca

activities.text: Local coffee tasting and roasting process demonstration

visits.text: Arrival on the Pacific coast at El Tunco, walk on the volcanic beach
Exploration of rock formations and sea caves accessible at low tide

activities.text: Beginner surf lesson on El Tunco beach

visits.text: Discovery of the Pacific coastline: villages of El Tunco and El Zonte, heart of Surf City.
Visit to La Libertad seafood market and Sunset Park.
Discovery of the coastal village of El Zonte and observation of surfers
Walk to the river mouth and sunset observation
Free morning on El Zonte beach to enjoy the calm and the Pacific

activities.text: Surfing lessons on Pacific waves.
Hiking in Walter Thilo Deininger park to observe wildlife and flora.
Participation in a baby sea turtle release program (seasonal)
Short hike to the Tamanique waterfalls located in the hinterland
Coastal walk between El Zonte and El Tunco to admire the cliffs and tropical vegetation

visits.text: Scenic route on the Ruta de las Flores through the villages of Juayua, Apaneca, Ataco and Nahuizalco.
Discovery of the waterfalls of Juayua and walk in the surrounding coffee plantations.
Hike to the Cascadas de Juayua (the Seven Waterfalls)
Stroll on the central square and discovery of artisan markets

activities.text: Swimming at the thermal waterfall Salto de Malacatiupan.

Participation in Juayua's gastronomic festival (if weekend)

activities.text: Sunrise observation over the Gulf islands from the mountain summit.

visits.text: Visit to the revolution museum in Perquín retracing the history of the civil conflict.
Discovery of El Mozote memorial monuments.

activities.text: Hiking to La Olomina and Las Pilas waterfalls in the surrounding mountains.

visits.text: Discovery of San Salvador's historic center: metropolitan cathedral, National Palace and Plaza Gerardo Barrios.
Exploration of the central market to discover local products and Salvadoran crafts.
Discovery of the historic center of San Salvador: Gerardo Barrios square, metropolitan cathedral and Palacio Nacional
Visit to Iglesia El Rosario, a masterpiece of modern architecture and colorful stained glass
Walk through Parque Cuscatlán and its memorial to victims of the civil war
Exploration of Mercado Central to discover crafts and local life

activities.text: Excursion to El Boquerón National Park and hike to the crater of San Salvador volcano.
Guided walking tour of downtown to understand the history and urban planning of San Salvador

Observation of Lake Coatepeque from the park's viewpoints

activities.text: Hike to Santa Ana volcano with view of the turquoise crater lake.
Walk in Cerro Verde national park to admire the Izalco and Santa Ana volcanoes.
Stop at Lake Coatepeque, swimming and panorama from the viewpoints.
Guided walk in Cerro Verde with park rangers to observe local fauna and flora
